page.title: 15LEAD MINING
page.content: SHELDON IS SITUATED IN A FORMER LEAD MINING AREA.EVIDENCE IS ALL AROUND IN THE FORM OF DISTURBED GROUND,SPOIL HEAPS,COVERED MINE SHAFTS AND SURFACE REMAINS OF MAGPIE MINE.THIS LATTER IS THE BEST EXAMPLE IN BRITAIN OF A 19 CENTURY LEAD MINE.IT HAS A FASCINATING HISTORY INCLUDING FIGHTS AND DISPUTES ENDING IN 3 'MURDERS',THE WIDOWS CURSE AND A HISTORY OF REPEATED DISASTERS AND FAILURES THERE AFTER.EARLIEST RECORDS OF THE MINE SHOW IT BEING WORKED ON A SMALL SCALE AROUND 1740 BUT ITS HEYDAY WAS THE 19 CENTURY. LIFE MUST HAVE BEEN VERY HARD FOR THE MINERS WHO WOULD HAVE WALKED FROM THE VILLAGE TO THE MINE (THE FOOTPATHS ARE STILL HERE)WHILE THE WOMEN LOOKED AFTER THE SMALLHOLDINGS.THE MINE FINALLY CLOSED IN 1953 AND IS NOW PRESERVED BY PEAK PARK AND PEAK DISTRICT MINES HISTORICAL SOCIETY.
